Translations.Text: And those who do not expect (their) meeting Us said: "Why are the angels not sent down to us, or (why) do we not see our Lord?” Truly, they have a false opinion of themselves with rudeness in their great arrogance
On the Day (when) they see the angels— There will be no joy for the sinners that Day: The (angels) will say: "There is a limit totally banned (for you)
And We shall turn to those deeds they did and We shall make such deeds like floating dust thrown around
The companions of the Garden (Paradise) will be well that Day, in their Home, and have the most beautiful and the happiest of places for rest
And the Day the heaven will be torn apart by clouds, and the angels shall be sent down, descending (in order and in grandeur)—
That Day, the Sovereignty of right and truth, shall be (only) for the Most Merciful (Ar-Rahman): And it will be a Day of great difficulty for the disbelievers
And the Day when the wrong-doer (of every type) will bite at his hands; He will say: "Oh! If only I had taken a (Straight) path with the Messenger (of Allah)
Oh! I am (now in) misery! If only I had never taken such an (Evil) one as a friend
He led me astray from the Message (of Allah, even) after it had come to me! And Satan is only a traitor to man
And the Messenger (Muhammad) will say: "O my Lord! Truly, my people (took the Message lightly and) abandoned this Quran
Like this We have made for every prophet an enemy from the criminals (and sinners): But your Lord is enough to guide and to help

And those who reject Faith say: "Why is Quran not sent to him all at once?" (It is sent) like this so that We may give strength to your heart with it, and We have made it known to you in slow well-ordered stages, little at a time
And no example or parable do they bring to you that We have not made known to you the truth and the best explanation (of the questions)
Those who will be gathered to Hell (fallen) on their faces— They will be in evil fate, on a path most astray
And indeed, (before this,) We sent Musa (Moses) the Scripture (Torah), and appointed his brother Haroon (Aaron) with him as minister
And We commanded: "Both of you, go to the people who have rejected Our Signs (verses):" And those (people) We destroyed with total ruin
And the people of Nuh (Noah)— When they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them like a Sign for (all) mankind: And We have prepared a (most) painful penalty for (all) wrongdoers—
And like (the people of) ‘Ad and Samood (Thamud), and the companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them
And for each one (of the peoples) We set forth parables and examples; And each one We broke to total ruin (for their sins)
And truly, the (disbelievers) must have passed by the town on which was rained by a shower of evil: Then did they not see it (with their own eyes)? But they fear not the Resurrection
And when they see you, they treat you no other way than in joke: "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger
Truly, he would have almost misled us from our gods, if we were not unchanging towards them!"— Soon will they know, when they see the penalty, who it is that is most misled from the (true) path
Do you see the one who takes for his god his own desire (or impulse)? Could you be a guardian of affairs for him
Or do you think that most of them listen or understand? They are only like cattle— No! They are worse astray in path

Have you not turned your sight (and thoughts) towards your Lord? How He pulls the shadow (longer during the evenings and mornings)! If He willed, He could make it fixed! Then We make the sun its guide (as it lengthens)
Then We draw it in towards Ourselves— A shortening by easy stages (during the night and noon)
And it is He Who makes the night as a (long) cover for you, and sleep as rest, and makes the day (like) a resurrection
And it is He Who sends the winds as messages of glad news (and tidings), that go before His Mercy (of the rain), and We send down pure water from the sky—
So that We may give life with it to the land that is dead, and quench the thirst of things We have created— Cattle and men in large numbers
And indeed, We have distributed the (water) among them, in order that they may recite (Our) praises, but most men are ungrateful and denying
And if it was Our Will, We could have sent a warner to every town
Therefore do not obey the disbelievers, but work hard against them with the greatest strength, (with the Quran by your side)

And it is He Who has released the two parts of flowing water; One (that is) drinkable and sweet, and the other (that is) salty and bitter; And He has set a barrier between them, a boundary forbidden to be crossed (by the waters)
And it is He Who has made man from water: Then He has set up relationships of family and marriage: And your Lord is ever All Powerful (Khadir, over all things)
And still, do they worship things besides Allah that can neither profit them nor harm them? And the disbeliever is a helper (of Evil), against his own Lord
And We only sent you (O Prophet), to give glad tidings and warning
Say: "I do not ask any reward from you for it except this: That each one who will (wish to do so), may take a (straight) Path to his Lord
And (you, O Muhammad!) put your trust in Him Who lives but does not die; And recite His Praise, and He is All Aware (Khabir) of the faults of His servants—

He Who created in six Days, the heavens and the earth and all in between, and rose over (Istawa) on the Throne (of Authority); (Allah,) the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman)! Then ask Him as the All Aware and informed (Khabir, about all things)

And when it is said to them, "You adore (Allah) the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman)!" They say, "And what is (Allah), the Most Gracious? Shall we adore that which you order us?” And it increases their flight (from the truth)
He is the blessed (One) Who made groups of stars in the skies, and placed a Lamp in there and a Moon giving light
And it is He Who made the night and the day to come after each other: For such as (those who) have the will to celebrate His Praise or to show their gratitude (to Allah)
And the servants of (Allah), the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman) are those who walk on the earth with humility, and when those who do not know talk to them, they (the servants, gently) say: "Peace
Those who spend the night in the devotion to their Lord (either) prostrate and standing
And those who say: "Our Lord! Take away from us the torture of Hell, verily, its torture is an eternal severely painful (and a fierce) punishment—
Evil indeed, is it as a home, and as a place to rest in
And those who, when they spend are not wasteful and not miserly, but hold a fair (balance) between those (limits)

And those who do not call, with Allah, any other god, and do not kill the life which Allah has made sacred, except for honest cause, and do not commit adultery— And any who does this (the evil acts) shall get the penalty
(And even) the penalty on the Day of Judgment will be doubled to him, and he will live in there with dishonor.—
Unless he repents, believes, and does rightful acts, because Allah will change the evil of such persons into good deeds, and Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)
And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah with a (true) change (towards righteousness)—
Those who do not testify to lies, and if they come by useless (things), they avoid it with honor
And those who, when they are warned by the Signs of their Lord, do not sink down (low) at them as if they were deaf or blind
And those who pray, "Our Lord! Give to us wives and children who will be the comfort of our eyes, and give us (the grace) to lead the righteous
Those are the ones who will be rewarded with the highest place (in Paradise), because of their patient constancy: Therein they will be met with welcome and with words of peace and respect
Living in there— How beautiful a home and place of rest
Say (to the disbelievers): “My Lord does not care for you if you do not pray to Him: But you have in fact rejected (Him), and soon will come the inescapable (punishment)!”
Ta Sin Mim
These are verses of the Book that clarifies (all the many things)
It may be that you upset your soul with sorrow, because they do not become believers
If (it) was Our Will, We can send down a Sign from the heaven to them, to which they will bow their necks in humility
But to them, there does not come (even) one new revelation from (Allah,) the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman), but they (already) turn away from it
Truly, they have rejected (the Message): So they will soon know the truth about that which they made fun
Do they not look at the earth— How many noble things of all types We have produced in there
Surely, there is a Sign in this: But most of them do not believe
And surely, your Lord is He, (Who is) Exalted in Might (Aziz), Most Merciful (Raheem)
And (remember) when, your Lord called unto Musa (and said): "Go to the people who are wrongdoers—
The people of Firon (Pharaoh): Will they not fear Allah
Said (Musa): "O my Lord! I fear that they may deny me (and accuse me of falsehood)
My chest may become strained: And my speech may not go smoothly; So send forth (with me) Haroon (Aaron)
And they have a charge of crime against me; And I fear that they may kill me
Said (Allah): "Not at all! Now both of you go with Our Signs; Verily, We are with you, and (We) will listen (to you)
So both of you, go forth to Firon (Pharaoh), and say: ‘We are the messengers of the Lord (and Cherisher) of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
‘You send with us the Children of Israel.’
(Firon) said (to Musa): "Did we not cherish you as a child with us, and did you not stay many years of your life amidst us
And you did an act that which you did (killed an Egyptian) and you are a thankless (wretch)
Musa (Moses) said: "I did it then, when I was wrong
So, I ran away from (all of) you, when I feared you; But (after that) my Lord has granted me judgment (and wisdom) and made me one of the messengers
And this is the old favor with which you put me to shame— That you have made the Children of Israel, (your) slaves
Firon (Pharaoh) said: "And what is the ‘Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)’
Said (Musa): "The Lord and Cherisher (Rab) of the heavens and the earth, and all between— If you want to be quite sure
Said (Pharaoh) to those around: "Do you not listen (to what he says)
Musa (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers (right) from the beginning
Said (Firon): "Truly, your messenger who has been sent to you is undeniably a madman
Said (Musa): "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! If you only had the sense (to understand)
Said (Firon): "If you bring forward any god other than me, I will really put you in prison
Said (Musa): "Even if I showed you something clear (enough) to make you believe
Said (Firon): "Show it then, if you tell the truth
So (Musa) threw his rod, and look, it was a (huge) snake, clearly (for all to see)
And he drew out his hand, and look! It was white (and bright) to the seers
(Firon) said to the chiefs around him: "This is truly a magician of high skill
His plan is to get you out of your land by his magic; Then what is it (that you) command
They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense, and send out the callers to the cities to collect—
And bring to you all magicians of high skill
So, the magicians were brought together for the event on a well known day
And the people were told: “Are you (all now) gathered
That we may follow (the religion of) the magicians, if they win?”
So, when the magicians arrived, they said to Firon (Pharaoh): "Truly— Shall we have a (worthy) reward if we win
Said (Firon): "Yes, (and more)— Because, in that case (if you win), you will be (given positions) near (to me)
Said Musa (Moses) to them: "You throw— Whatever you are about to throw
So, they threw their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the might of Firon (Pharaoh), it is we who will really win
Then (Musa) threw his rod, when, look! It right away swallows up all the lies that they make up
Then the magicians fell down, prostrate in praise
Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
The Lord of Musa (Moses) and Haroon (Aaron)

Said (Firon): "Will you believe in Him (Allah) before I give you permission? Surely, he (Musa) is your chief, who has taught you magic! But you will know soon! Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross
They said: "(That) does not matter! About us, we shall only go back to our Lord
Verily, our desire is that our Lord will forgive us for our mistakes, that we may become first among the believers
By inspiration We revealed to Musa (Moses): "Go (away from Firon) by night with My servants; Because surely, you will be chased
Then Firon (Pharaoh) sent news to (all) the Cities
These (people) are only a small group
And they are very angry against us
But we are a many more with enough warning
So We expelled them from gardens, springs
Treasures, and every kind of honorable position
It was like this, that We made the Children of Israel inheritors of these things
So they (Firon) chased them (Musa and the Israelites) at sunrise
And when the two groups saw each other, the Musa's (Moses’) people said: "We are sure to be overtaken (and overrun)
(Musa) said: "Not at all! My Lord is with me! He will soon guide me
Then We told Musa (Moses) by revelation: "Strike the sea with your rod." And so, it (the sea) divided, and each separate part became like the huge, firm part of a mountain
And We made the other people come there
We saved Musa (Moses) and all who were with him
Then We drowned the others
Surely, there is a Sign in this: But most of them do not believe
And surely your Lord is He (Who is), the Exalted in Might (Al-Aziz), Most Merciful (Raheem)
And recite to them Ibrahim (Abraham)’s story
When he said to his father and his people "What do you worship
They said: "We worship idols, and we remain attending to them always
He said: "Do they listen to you when you call unto (them)
Or do (they) cause (any) good or harm to you
They said: "No, but we found our fathers doing like this (what we do)
He said: "Then do you see what you have been worshipping—
You and your fathers before you
Verily, they are enemies to me; except the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
Who created me, and it is He Who guides me
And it is He Who gives me food and gives me drink
And when I am ill, it is He Who cures me
And it is He Who will cause me to die, and then bring me to life (again)
And Who, I hope, will forgive me for my mistakes on the Day of Resurrection
O my Lord! Give me wisdom, and join me with the righteous (people)
And give me honorable saying on the tongue of truth of the later (generations) to come
And make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of (Eternal) Joy (the Paradise)
And forgive my father, verily, he is among those who go astray
And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be raised up;"—
The Day when neither wealth nor sons will be of (any) use
Except only he who brings to Allah a good heart (will be treated well)
The Garden will be brought near to the righteous
And the Fire will be placed in full sight to those lost in evil
And it shall be said to them: "Where are the (gods that) you worshipped—
Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves
Then they will be cast right into the (Fire)— They and those lost in evil
And the whole groups from (the race of) Satan altogether
They will say, while they quarrel in there
‘By Allah, truly, we were in a clear error
‘When we held you (Satan) as equal to the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
‘And none has led us astray except those who were criminals, (deeply) soaked in sin
‘Then, we have none to intercede (for us) now
‘Nor a close single friend to feel (sorry for us now)
Now if we only had a chance to return, we shall truly be of those who believe!’
Surely in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe
And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)
The people of Nuh (Noah) denied the messengers
When their brother Nuh (Noah) said to them: "Will you not fear and obey (Allah, in total trust or Taq'wa)
I am to you a messenger fit for all trust
So fear Allah, and obey me
I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds
So fear Allah, and obey me
They said: "Shall we believe in you when it is the lowliest who follow you
He (Noah) said: "And what do I know about what they do
Their account is only with my Lord, if you can (only) understand
I am not one to drive away those who believe
I am only a plain Warner (to warn you clearly)
They said: "O Nuh (Noah)! If you do no stop, you will be stoned (to death)
He said: "O my Lord! Truly my people have rejected me
Then, You judge between me and them openly, and save me and those of the believers who are with me
And We saved him and those with him, in the Ark full of (all of creatures)
After that We drowned those who remained behind
Surely in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe
And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)
The ‘Ad (people) rejected the messengers
When their brother Hud said to them; "Will you not fear (Allah)
Verily, I am to you a messenger fit for all trust
So fear Allah and obey me
I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
Do you build an important place on every high place to bring joy to yourselves
And do you get for yourselves fine buildings with the hope of living in there (for ever)
And when you play your strong hand (with force), do you act like cruel men with absolute power
Now fear Allah, and obey me
Yes, fear Him Who has given you freely all that you know
He has freely given you cattle and sons—
And gardens and springs
Truly, I fear the Penalty of a Great Day for you
They said: "It is the same for us if you preach (warn) us or do not be among (our) warners
This is nothing different from the customary actions of the ancient (people)
And we are not the ones to take pains and penalties
So they rejected him, and We destroyed them. Surely there is a Sign in this but most of them do not believe
And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)
The Samood (Thamud people) rejected the messengers
When their brother Salih said to them: "Will you not fear (Allah)
I am to you a messenger fit for all trust
So fear Allah, and obey me
I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
Will you be left safe (for ever), in (the enjoyment of) all that you have here
In gardens and springs
And corn-fields and date palms with their (leafy) covers almost breaking (with the weight of fruit)
And you dig out houses out of (rocky) mountains with high skill
But fear Allah and obey me
And do not follow the call of those who are wasteful—
Who do mischief in the land, and do not correct (their ways)
They said: "You are only one of those under a (magical) spell
You are no more than a human like us: "Then bring us a Sign, if you tell the truth
He said: "Here is a she-camel: She has a right to (come to the) water, and you have a right to (come to the) water, on a day appointed
And do not touch her with harm, or the penalty of the Great Day seize you
But they killed her (by cutting the hamstrings): Then they became full of sorrow
But the penalty seized them, surely there is indeed a Sign in this but most of them do not believe
And surely your Lord is He (Who is), the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)
The people of Lut (Lot) rejected the messengers
When their brother Lut (Lot) said to them: "Will you not fear (Allah)
Verily, I am to you a messenger fit for all trust
So, fear Allah and obey me
I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
Will you run after males, of all creation (made) in the worlds
And leave those (the females) whom Allah has made for you to be your wives? No! You are a people exceeding (all moral limits)
They said: "O Lut (Lot)! If you do not stop, you will surely be one of those driven out
He said: "I am one of those who disapproves your acts (of sodomy) with severe hate and anger
O my Lord! Save me and my family from such things like what they do
So, We saved him and his family— All
Except an old woman who kept behind
But the rest We destroyed totally
And, We rained down on them a shower (of hard clay-stone): And evil was the shower on those who were warned (but did not listen)
Surely there is a Sign in this but most of them do not believe
And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)
The companions of the Wood rejected the messengers
When Shu’aib said to them: "Will you not fear (Allah)
I am to you a messenger fit for all trust
So fear Allah and obey me
I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
Give proper measure (to others) and do not make loss (for others by cheating)
And weigh with true and upright scales
And do not defraud (hold back) things that are truly due to men, and do no evil in the land, by making mischief
And fear Him Who created you and the generations before (you)
They said: "You are only one of those under a (magical) spell
You are no more than a human like us: And really, we think that you one of the liars
Now make a piece of the sky to fall on us, if you are truthful
He said: "My Lord knows well what you do
But they denied him. Then the punishment of a day of great sorrow seized them, indeed that was the penalty of a Great Day
Surely, in that, there is a Sign but most of them do not believe
And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)
And Truly, this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
With this (the Quran), the Spirit [Gabriel] of truth came down (to bring it)—
To your heart and (to your) mind that you (O Prophet) may warn and guide
In clear (and easily understood) Arabic tongue
And without doubt it is (from) the mystic Books of the earlier peoples
Is it not a Sign to them that the learned from the Children of Israel knew it (as true)
If We had revealed it to any of the non-Arabs
And if he read it to them, they would not have believed in it
Like this We have made it enter the hearts (and minds) of the criminals
They will not believe in it until they see the painful penalty
But the (penalty) will come to them swiftly, when they are not aware of it
Then they will say: Will we be given some relief
Then do they ask them for Our Penalty to be hurried on
Do you see? (Even) if We let them enjoy (this life) for a few years
And still at the end, there will come to them (the punishment) that they were promised
It will not help them that they enjoyed (this life)
And We never ruined a population that did not have its warners—
As a reminder (to mankind); And We never are unjust
And no Satans' (or the Evil ones) have brought down this (Message)
It would not befit them, and they would not be able (to produce it)
As a fact, they have been removed far away from even hearing it
So do not call on any other god with Allah, or you will be from those under the penalty
And advise and warn your nearest relatives
And lower you arms (as greetings) to the believers who follow you
Even then, if they disobey you, say: I am free (of responsibility) for what you do
And place your trust on the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)
Who sees you standing up (in prayer)
And (sees) your movements among those who prostrate themselves
Verily, it is He Who hears and knows all things
(O my people!) Shall I inform you, on whom it is that Satans' (or the Evil ones) come down
They come down on every lying, sinful person
(In their ears) they fill half-true, worthless things, and most of them are liars
As for the poets— Those astray (in evil) who follow them
Do you not see that they (anxiously) speak about every subject (of lies and sin) in their poetry
And that they say what they do not do

Except those who believe and work rightfully, and do much in the remembering of Allah, and (act to) defend themselves only after they are wrongly attacked. And soon will the unjust attackers know what sudden changes their actions will take
Ta Sin: These are the Signs (verses) of the Quran— A Book that makes (things) clear
A Guide; And glad tiding (news) to the believers—
Those who perform prayers regularly and give charity regularly, and also have (total) belief in the Hereafter
Verily, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their actions pleasing in their eyes; And so they walk around lost without a focus
These are they for whom lies a painful penalty: And their loss will be greatest in the Hereafter
And verily, you (O Prophet!), the Quran is granted upon you from the One, All Wise (Hakeem), All Knowing (Aleem)

(Remember) when Musa (Moses) said to his household: "Surely, I see a fire; Soon I will bring you some news from there, or I will bring you a burning piece to light our (own fire) fuel, so that you may warm yourselves
But when he came to the (fire), he was called: "Those in the fire and those around are blessed: And Glory to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds (Rub-ul-'Ala'meen)
O Musa (Moses)! Surely, I am Allah, the Supreme in Might (Al-Aziz), the Wise! (Al-Hakeem)

And now you throw your rod!" But when he saw it moving (by itself) like it was a snake, he was set back wondering, and (he) did not look back on his steps: (Again, the voice said), "O Musa (Moses)! Do not be afraid! Truly, in My Presence, those called as messengers (they) do not have (any) fear—
But if any have done wrong and have afterwards replaced good in place of evil, then truly, I am Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

Now put your hand on your chest, and it will come out white without stain: (These are) from the nine Signs (you will take) to Firon (Pharaoh) and his people: Verily, they are unruly people exceeding all limits
But when Our Signs came to them that should have (really) opened their eyes, they said: "This is clearly magic
And they denied (rejected) those Signs with injustice and pride, even though their souls were convinced of them: So, see what was the end of those who acted wrongly
And indeed, We gave knowledge to Dawood (David) and to Sulaiman (Solomon): And they both said: "All the Praises (and thanks) be to Allah, Who has chosen us above many of His servants who believe

And Sulaiman (Solomon) was to inherit after Dawood (David). He said: "O you people! We have been taught the language of Birds, and to us is given (a little) of all things: Truly, this is (by Allah’s) clear Grace
And before Sulaiman (Solomon) were gathered his armies— Of jinns' and men, and birds, and all of them marching forward in order and ranks
Till when they came to a valley of the ants, (and) one of the ants said: "O you ants, get into your houses, lest Sulaiman (Solomon) and his armies will crush you (while marching) without knowing it

So he (Sulaiman) smiled, amused at her speech; And he said: "O my Lord! Command me that I may be thankful for Your mercies, which You have blessed upon me and upon my parents, and that I may act righteous that will please You: And admit me, by Your Grace, to the ranks of your righteous servants
And he took a troop of the birds, and he said: "Why is it I see not the Hoopoe? (A bird with feathers like a crown on its head ) or is he from those absent
I will really punish him with a harsh penalty, or (even) kill him, unless he brings to me a clear reason (for being absent)

But (the Hoopoe) did not stay behind too far: He (approached Sulaiman and) said: "I have traveled (through lands) where you have not gone and I have come to you from Saba (Sheba) with true (and correct) news
I found a woman (queen Bilqiz) ruling (there) over them and made things available for every want; And she has a grand (and beautiful) throne

I found her and her people worshipping the sun besides Allah: Satan has made their actions appear pleasing to their eyes, and (he) has kept them away from the (Straight) Way— So they receive no guidance—
(And) so they do not prostrate themselves before Allah, Who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you hide and what you show
Allah! There is no god but He! Lord of the Throne Supreme (Rab-ul-Arsh Al-Azeem)
(Sulaiman) said: "Soon shall we see if you have told the truth or you are one of the liars
Go you with this letter from me, and give it to them: Then get back from them, and (wait to) see what answer they give back
She (the queen of Saba) said: "You chiefs! Here is a letter delivered to me— A noble letter
It is from Sulaiman (Solomon), and is (written): ‘In the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful
‘You do not act proudly with me, but come to me as Muslims, in submission (to the Religion of Allah).’
She (the queen) said: "You chiefs! Advise me about (this) ordeal of mine: No ordeal have I decided without your presence
They said: "We are blessed with great strength, and used to fierce war: But the power is with you; So think about what you will command
She said: "Verily, when kings enter a country, ruin it, and make the noblest from its people, its meanest; They act like this
But verily, I am going to send him (Sulaiman) a present, and (wait) to see with what (answer) return (my) ministers

So, when (the ministers) came to Sulaiman (Solomon), he said: "Will you give me a lot of wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than what He has given to you! Really! It is you who take joy in your gift
Go back to them, and be sure we will come to them with strong armies that they will never be able to meet: And we shall remove them from there in disgrace, and they will feel in low position
He said (to his own army): "You chiefs! Which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me surrendering as Muslims, in submission

Said an Ifrit, from the (race of) jinns': "I will bring it to you before you get up from your Court (and gathering now): Truly, I have the full strength for the deed, and (I am) trustworthy for such work (service to you)

Said one who had knowledge of the Scripture: "I will bring it to you by the blinking of an eye!" then as (Sulaiman) saw it placed firmly before him, he said: "This is by the Grace of my Lord! To test me whether I am thankful or unthankful! And if anyone is thankful, truly, his gratitude is (only for the good) for his own soul; But if anyone is unthankful, truly, My Lord is free of all Needs (Ghani), All Bountiful (Kareem, in His generosity)
He said: "Change her throne that it is beyond recognition by her let us see whether she is guided (to Allah) or (she) is one of those who takes no guidance

So when she arrived, she was asked, "Is your throne like this?” She said; "(It is) as if it was just the same;" He said: "Knowledge was bestowed to us before her, and we have submitted to Allah (in Islam)
And she came away from the worship of others besides Allah: For she was from a people who had no faith

She was asked to enter the high palace: but when she saw it, she thought it was a pool (lake) of water, and (pulled up her skirts), showing her legs. He (Sulaiman) said: "This is only a palace smoothly covered with sheets of glass." She said: "O my Lord! Truly, I have wronged my soul: And I submit with Sulaiman (Solomon) to Allah and to the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)
(Before now), We sent to the Samood (Thamud), their brother Salih, saying, "Worship (serve) Allah:" But look! They became two groups arguing with each other
He said: "O my people! Why do you hurry to evil rather than the good? If you only ask Allah for forgiveness, you can (still) hope to receive (His) mercy
They said: "We foresee bad sign from you, and from those who are with you." He said: "Your bad sign is with Allah; Yes, you are a people under trial
And in the City, there were Nine men of a family, who made mischief in the land, and would not correct (themselves)

(Among themselves) they said: "Make a common oath by Allah that we shall make a secret night-attack on him (Salih) and his household, and that we shall then tell his heirs (when they want to punish us): 'We were not there at the killing of his household, and verily, we are surely telling the truth
So they plotted and planned but We too planned, even while they were not aware of it
Then see what was the end of their plan! (Only) this— That We ruined them and their people, altogether
Now their houses were like this— In utter ruin, because they did wrong, surely in this, there is a Sign for people with knowledge
And We saved those who believed and did righteousness
(And We also sent) Lut (Lot, as a prophet): When he said to his people, "You do what is shameful (sodomy), even though you see (it is wrong and unjust)
Would you really run after men in your excessive (sexual) desire rather than after women? No! You are a people (totally) ignorant
